project.teaser: The wind industry is developing wind turbines and airborne wind energy devices which span altitudes well above the well-studied surface layer. A full understanding of the unsteady inflow conditions which drive loads and performance at these altitudes is lacking. MERIDIONAL...
project.objective: The wind industry is developing wind turbines and airborne wind energy devices which span altitudes well above the well-studied surface layer. A full understanding of the unsteady inflow conditions which drive loads and performance at these altitudes is lacking. MERIDIONAL will provide a comprehensively validated tool chain based on an open-source platform which will draw on an integrated knowledge and data hub to allow the efficient and accurate assessment of the performance and loads experienced by onshore, offshore, and airborne wind energy systems. This tool chain can be used for component, device and plant level planning and operation. It will consist of models which can capture the unsteady time-resolved inflow structures which drive performance and loads within the wind plant, incorporating inter and intra farm turbine interactions. Inflow conditions will be analysed and modelled beyond the surface layer to capture the conditions within and above the atmospheric boundary layer. This is critical to a full understanding of the loads and performance of wind farms and airborne wind energy devices. Model validation will be underpinned by a range of high quality and unique datasets drawing on high-fidelity simulations, and kite-borne, lidar, drone and mast measurements from field test campaigns in complex terrain, offshore and airborne. The strength of the tool chain results from developing different models for different situations, using higher order approaches (e.g., meso and microscale LES) when required and lower order models (physics or data-driven) where these are sufficient to accurately predict loads and performance. The knowledge and data hub will allow users of the tool chain to draw on a wide range of existing and project-generated measurement and simulation data to allow site specific analysis to be carried out at any location. MERIDIONAL allows stakeholders to increase wind plant efficiency and reduce material costs through less conservative design.
project.title: Multiscale modelling for wind farm design, performance assessment and loading
project.keywords: Modelling, measurement, CFD, LES, loads, database, turbulence, wakes, resource, AWES, wind farms, wind turbines, energy yield, drones, kites, AI

article.title: Inflow conditions analysed beyond the surface layer

result.title: Wind inflow observation from load harmonics via neural networks: A simulation and field study

details.authors: Kwang-Ho Kim; Marta Bertelè, Carlo L. Bottasso

result.title: Interim report on best practice guidelines for modelling loads and performance
result.description: The report will contain guidelines and recommendations for how to assess the sensitivity of inflow conditions and rotor modelling on the resulting loads and performance of the wind turbine. It includes Task 4.1-4.4 and covers both offshore and airborne wind power, and includes stand-alone wind turbines as well as wind turbines in wind farms.

result.title: Integrated toolchain for loads and performance prediction with documentation
result.description: The open-source design analysis and optimisation platform, developed in Sub-Task 5.1.1, will be uploaded to an open-access repository. The deliverable will also include an accompanying documentation, to allow users to integrate and couple different tools, apply the toolchain to onshore/offshore and aerial systems, and extend the platform based on need.

result.title: How do technological choices affect the economic and environmental performance of offshore wind farms?

details.authors: S Kainz, A Guilloré, C L Bottasso

result.title: Large-Scale Reverse Pumping for Rigid-Wing Airborne Wind Energy Systems

details.authors: Tareg Mohammed, Jørgen Busk, Espen Oland, Lorenzo Fagiano
details.journalTitle: Journal of Guidance, Control, and Dynamics
details.publisher: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)

result.title: Database of model simulations carried out in Task 3.3
result.description: A database of validated model simulation data will be created which can be used in the temporal and spatial characterisation of inflow and turbulent wake conditions experienced by wind turbines and wind farms.

result.title: Reconstruction of environmental site conditions by the integration of SCADA and reanalysis data
Database of pre-existing meteorological data sources suitable for inflow and wake turbulence modelling
result.description: A database will be created of preexisting meteorological data based on publicly available sources of relevance to inflow and turbulence modelling for wind turbines and wind farms

result.title: Transforming Laser-Scanned 750 kW Turbine Surface Geometry Data into Smooth CAD for CFD Simulations

details.publisher: Office of Scientific and Technical Information (OSTI)

result.title: Interim report on characterisation & modelling of inflow & wake turbulence
result.description: This is a report detailing the interim results of the work of the tasks in WP3 to characterise and model inflow and wake turbulence. The intention of this deliverable is to provide a progress report on the work approximately mid-way through WP3 to identify the most promising approaches.

result.title: Knowledge and data hub with documentation concerning workflows
result.description: With this deliverable, functionalities of the knowledge and data hub will be provided to users, together with the documentation. The information regarding simulation and analysis workflows, for which the hub can be utilized, will be included as well. The deliverable will cover activities of all the tasks in the work package 2. The first version will be published in month 24, followed by the update in month 48.

result.title: Refining the airborne wind energy system power equations with a vortex wake model

details.authors: Filippo Trevisi, Carlo E. D. Riboldi, and Alessandro Croce

result.title: Extension and Validation of Minimalistic Prediction Model to Determine the Energy Production of Offshore Wind Farms

result.title: Report on data standardisation and metadata templates
result.description: This report will document task 2.2’s data management efforts associated with findability and interoperability. An overview of the developed metadata template will be given. In addition, activities regarding data standardization necessary for ensuring interoperability will be reported as well

result.title: Closed-loop coupling of a dynamic wake model with a wind inflow estimator

details.authors: J Di Cave, R Braunbehrens, J Krause, A Guilloré, C L Bottasso

category.title: drones
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/robotics/autonomous robots/drones

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
